title: Karl Stefanovic cuddles up to wife Jasmine Yarbrough at Lunching for Melanoma event in Brisbane
text:
Karl Stefanovic hosted a cancer charity event 'Lunching for Melanoma' at Brisbane's Howard Smith Wharves over the weekend, after reportedly experiencing a skin cancer scare last year.

The former Today show host attended the event with his wife Jasmine Stefanovic (née Yarbrough), 34, with the pair seen cuddling up at a table with other guests.

Karl was all smiles as Jasmine hugged the TV veteran from behind for the sweet photograph.

Karl Stefanovic hosted a cancer charity event 'Lunching for Melanoma' at Brisbane 's Howard Smith Wharves over the weekend with wife Jasmine Yarbrough after reportedly experiencing a skin cancer scare last year

'Last weekend at the charity luncheon for @lunchingformelanoma @ginasavage1 you are such an inspirational woman #f**kcancer,' Jasmine captioned the group photo

In the photo, they were also wearing branded caps that read: 'f**k cancer.'

Looking suave: Karl was dressed in a smart navy suit with a pink button-up shirt as he hosted the event (Pictured: Karl with event organiser Gina Savage)

Karl has previously reported on event organiser Gina Savage's journey with skin cancer when he was a host on Nine's breakfast program Today.

'Excited to have @karlstefanovic_ hosting this years Lunching for Melanoma. Bring on October 12 #lunching4melanoma #f**kcancer,' she wrote on social ahead of the event.

The charity event raised $137k.

They go way back! Karl (L) has previously reported on event organiser Gina Savage's (R) journey with skin cancer when he was a host on Nine's breakfast program Today

According to New Idea in January 2018, Karl secretly visited Gold Coast physician Dr Portia Millar and later emerged with a bandage covering his right arm.

The magazine claimed Karl, who was accompanied by his then-shoe designer girlfriend Jasmine, was treated for what was believed to be skin cancer.

An hour later, the Gold Logie winner was spotted leaving the clinic sporting a bandage around his arm.

Last October, it was reported by the same publication that the This Time Next Year host had a biopsy on his left arm for a suspected melanoma.

However, Karl has never publicly spoken about or confirmed any skin cancer scares.
description: Axed Today host Karl Stefanovic, 45, reportedly experienced a skin cancer scare last year, with a suspected melanoma removed from his left arm.
authors: Candice Jackson For Daily Mail Australia
